author: niranb
content: <@763914540378226719> Should panda-pulse be able to run against any grafana instance within an ethpandaops/ethereum-package kurtosis setup? I have a kurtosis-based test harness set up for reducing the bandwidth available to a node (https://github.com/niran/blob-benchmarks), and I'd love to avoid reimplementing the checks that panda-pulse already has.

author: mattyevans
content: <@638864671608406077> Nice! your mileage may vary, but I can definitely provide you with dashboard json that should get you most of the way there. I'll message you

author: jgm
content: Is anyone at the EF interested in paying for an audit of a batch deposit contract for validators that supports pectra?  The most commonly-used one on mainnet, abyss, does not allow for deposits <>32ETH, so I have written a new one at https://github.com/attestantio/batch-validator-depositor but it is unaudited.

author: barnabasbusa
content: any reason you didn't add functionality to ethdo to do batch deposits?

author: jgm
content: `ethdo` just generates deposit data.  It's on my list to add in direct transaction data for the above batch deposit contract, but I've only just written it so one thing at a time ðŸ™‚

author: barnabasbusa
content: btw does ethdo support electra beacon state?

author: barnabasbusa
content: I have just built latest master and getting decode issues

author: barnabasbusa
content:
```
ethdo epoch --connection http://beacon.holesky.ethpandaops.io summary --timeout 120s
Connections to remote beacon nodes should be secure.  This warning can be silenced with --allow-insecure-connections
Error: failed to process
failed to parse validators: failed to obtain validators []: failed to decode electra beacon state
incorrect offset
```

author: jgm
content: I'm seeing the same problem with that command, but it works if I point it to a local beacon node.  Can you try it with a local node?

author: ustas.eth
content:
Hey! I'm trying to run kurtosis with the following config

```
participants:
  - el_type: geth
    cl_type: lighthouse
    cl_image: "sigp/lighthouse:v7.0.0-beta.3"
    # el_extra_params: ["--verbosity 5"]
    count: 2
network_params:
  seconds_per_slot: 6
  min_validator_withdrawability_delay: 2
  electra_fork_epoch: 1
  prefunded_accounts: '{"0x8646861A7cF453dDD086874d622b0696dE5b9674": {"balance": "1ETH"}, "0x13d1913d623E6a9D8811736359E50fD31Fe54fCA": {"balance": "1ETH"}}'
  deposit_contract_address: "0x00000000219ab540356cbb839cbe05303d7705fa"
additional_services:
  - dora
  - el_forkmon
  - forky
```

The `min_validator_withdrawability_delay: 2` param doesn't seem to work for some reason, I'm still getting `ExitValidationError(Invalid(TooYoungToExit { current_epoch: Epoch(2), earliest_exit_epoch: Epoch(256) }))`. Does anybody know what I'm doing wrong?
